newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: Thousands join Argentine truck drivers protest.
newsitem.headline: Thousands join Argentine truck drivers protest.

text.p: Almost 2,000 trucks filed slowly down a national highway in central Argentina on Monday, the second day of a national truck drivers protest against foreign competiton, local news agencies said.

About 1,000 trucks left the western province of Mendoza on Sunday for the 621-mile (1,000 kilometer) drive to the city of Lujan, in Buenos Aires province, with hundreds more trucks joining the protest along the way.
As many as 3,000 vehicles were set to converge Tuesday on Lujan, where the protest is to end with a mass outside the city cathedral, the reports said.
The vehicles, carrying fuel, gas, livestock, cereal, fruit and vegetables, formed a 22-mile-long (40-kilometer) column Monday on national highway 7.

The truck drivers union has threatened to call a 14-day strike that would block the country's border crossings if the government does not draft a law protecting their jobs from foreign transportation firms.
